FuncDef: The display pim ipv6 interface command displays information about an IPv6 PIM interface.
CLIs: display pim ipv6 interface [ <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> | up | down ] [ verbose ]
display pim ipv6 { vpn-instance <instance-name> | all-instance } interface [ <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> | up | down ] [ verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Specifies the number of an interface.
-

Displays information about the IPv6 PIM interface whose protocol status is Up.
-

Displays information about the IPv6 PIM interface whose protocol status is Down.
-

Displays detailed information about an IPv6 PIM interface.
-

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Examples: Interface           State NbrCnt HelloInt   DR-Pri     DR-Address
<HUAWEI> display pim ipv6 interface gigabitethernet 1/0/0 verbose
PIM state-refresh capability on link: non-capable
Number of routers on link not using DR priority: 0
Number of routers on link not using LAN delay: 0
Number of routers on link not using neighbor tracking: 1
ACL of PIM neighbor policy: myacl6
ACL of PIM ASM join policy: 2000
ACL of PIM SSM join policy: -
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The interface enabled with PIM is called a PIM interface. The display pim ipv6 interface command is used to display information about an IPv6 PIM interface, including the PIM status, number of PIM neighbors, interval for sending Hello messages, Designated router (DR) priority, and DR address.
Precautions
If ifType and ifNum parameters are specified but the pim ipv6 sm command is not enabled on this interface, an error is prompted.
